answers.text: the parliament of the Irish Free State

qas.question: What did the Oireachtas remove from the Irish constitution?

answers.text: all direct mention of the monarch

qas.question: Which act gave the monarch limited authority in Ireland?
What day did the Oireachtas pass an act that started to establish Ireland as a republic?
What was the name of the first act?

context: On the <a3_0>day of the abdication<a3_0/>, the Oireachtas, <a0_0>the parliament of the <b7_0>Irish Free State<b7_0/><a0_0/>, removed <a1_0>all direct mention of the monarch<a1_0/> from the Irish constitution. The next day, it passed the <a2_0><b5_0>External Relations Act<b5_0/><a2_0/>, which gave <b4_0><b6_0>the monarch<b6_0/><b4_0/> limited authority (strictly on the advice of the government) to appoint diplomatic representatives for Ireland and to be involved in the making of foreign treaties. The two acts made the Irish Free State a republic in essence without removing its links to the Commonwealth.
